item.title: [One last error]
item.dc:creator: @Tatemo Tatemo
item.description:
@Tatemo wrote:

updateRequired = true; appearanceUpdateRequired = true; return true; }

This needs an open bracket somewhere and u need to add another close bracket after quite a few things as the open and close brackets have to even up[br][br][size=1]Posted on: January 28, 2009, 12:14:21 am[/size][hr]Its hard to see which brackets are which but im pretty sure u need at least 2 more close brackets ATLEAST i would recount them if i were u

item.title: [One last error]
item.dc:creator: @jc22493 Jc22493
item.description:
@jc22493 wrote:

Hey, I was adding throwing knives to my source, and I am stumped with this last error.
Here is the error.

client.java:7634: illegal start of expression public boolean DeleteRing() { ^ 1 error Press any key to continue . . .

Yes, it does look simple, but I’ve tried adding brackets before it, but it didn’t work.

Here is the code.

[code] }
updateRequired = true;
appearanceUpdateRequired = true;
return true;
}
public boolean DeleteKnife() {
if (playerEquipmentN[playerWeapon] == 0) {
deleteequiment(playerEquipment[playerWeapon], playerWeapon);
return false;
}
public boolean DeleteRing() {
if (playerEquipmentN[playerWeapon] == 0) {
deleteequiment(playerEquipment[playerWeapon], playerWeapon);
return false;
}

	if ((playerEquipmentN[playerWeapon] > 0) && System.currentTimeMillis() -

lastAction > actionInterval) {
outStream.createFrameVarSizeWord(34);
outStream.writeWord(1688);
outStream.writeByte(playerWeapon);
outStream.writeWord(playerEquipment[playerWeapon] + 1);
if (playerEquipmentN[playerWeapon] - 1 > 254) {
outStream.writeByte(255);
outStream.writeDWord(playerEquipmentN[playerWeapon] - 1);
} else {
outStream.writeByte(playerEquipmentN[playerWeapon] - 1); //

amount
}
outStream.endFrameVarSizeWord();
playerEquipmentN[playerWeapon] -= 1;
}[/code]

Any help would be appreciated! I hope I’m not just not noticing some silly mistake.
Thanks in advance!
